title: Hybrid AI-powered computer vision combines physics and big data
summary: A study published in Nature Machine Intelligence discusses a hybrid methodology that combines physics and data-driven approaches to improve the capabilities of AI-based machinery. The study outlines three ways in which physics and data are being integrated into computer vision AI, including incorporating physics into AI data sets, network architectures, and network loss functions. This hybrid approach has shown promising results in improving computer vision, such as more precise object tracking and the ability to produce high-resolution images in challenging conditions. The researchers suggest that with further progress, deep learning-based AIs may even learn the laws of physics on their own. The study was supported by grants from the Army Research Laboratory and various other organizations.
